business.headline: Will AI change how you invest your money in stocks and mutual funds?The next market shift may not come from earnings or interest rates. It may come from AI. In this article, we explore how it could reshape your stock and mutual fund investments.

Air India fined Rs 1 crore for flying Airbus 8 times without airworthiness permitThe DGCA has imposed a fine of about Rs 1 crore on Air India for flying an Airbus aircraft eight times without a valid airworthiness permit. The aviation watchdog also said the lapse further eroded public trust in the airline.

Why personalised loans are becoming the go-to option in 2026The journey of hyper-personalisation in personal loans is going to get more exciting for customers with the increasing adoption of technology refining customer offerings, based on minute details of the customers.

RBI plans to update Kisan Credit Card rules : 5 key changes to trackThe Reserve Bank of India is preparing to overhaul the Kisan Credit Card scheme, and the proposed changes could reshape how farmers borrow and repay loans. With the new draft rules on the table, what exactly is set to change for farm credit?

Sensex crashes over 1,000 points: What's behind today's market bloodbath?The market opened on a weak note and remained under pressure throughout the session, with losses deepening in the second half. The decline appeared to be driven by profit booking at elevated levels and a cautious mood among investors amid global uncertainties.

Reliance wins US licence for Venezuelan oil as India wavers on Russia supplyReliance applied for the licence in early January as India looks to diversify its energy purchases. Direct purchase of Venezuelan oil will help Reliance replace Russian oil in a cost-effective way.

Cheque bounced? How one mistake can spiral into legal and financial troubleA bounced cheque may seem like a minor slip, but it can quickly trigger penalties, credit damage and even legal complications. What starts as a simple payment error can snowball into a serious financial setback. Are you aware of the risks?

8th Pay Commission: Government seeks public feedback; who can participateThe recommendations of the 8th Pay Commission are expected to influence future salary structures, allowances and pension benefits for central government staff.

Gold, silver prices rise slightly: Rise ahead or fall on the cards?After days of volatility, gold and silver have posted modest gains, catching the attention of investors. The small rise has reopened a familiar debate, i.e., are precious metals preparing for another climb, or is a fresh dip still possible?

RBI steps in to stop mis-selling by banks: Decoding what's good and what's not clearThe Reserve Bank of India has signalled its intent after years of rising mis-selling complaints. But will this draft protect ordinary customers before the next grievance is filed? In this article, we break down what changes, what remains unclear, and whether enforcement can finally make a difference.

65-10-10-15 rule: How a 4-asset 'boring thali' portfolio helps in uncertain marketsWhen markets feel uncertain and investors struggle to decide where to put their money, a simple multi-asset strategy is drawing attention. Instead of chasing trends, the 65-10-10-15 "boring thali" approach focusses on balance and steady investing.

Is it the end of the road for silver after a spectacular rally?After a stunning rally and an equally sharp fall, silver now sits at a crucial crossroads, leaving investors wondering whether this correction is nearing its end or still gathering momentum.

Sensex crashes over 1,000 points: Why is the stock market falling today?At 3:16 pm, the Sensex was down 1055.91 points to 82,619.01, while the Nifty stood at 25,481.35, lower by 325.85 points. The fall was led by heavy selling in IT stocks, but the triggers lie largely in global developments.

TCS, Infosys sink nearly 6%: 3 reasons why IT stocks are falling againShares of TCS and Infosys fell nearly 6% in early trade, dragging the Nifty IT index lower. The weakness was not driven by any one company-specific announcement. Instead, it reflects a mix of global triggers and rising uncertainty around how artificial intelligence will reshape the industry.

Sensex drops 700 points as AI panic hits IT stocks; Infosys, TCS drop 5%The Sensex fell over 700 points in early trade, while the Nifty slipped below the 25,600 mark. The decline was led by frontline technology majors such as Infosys and TCS, along with other large-cap IT names.

Retail inflation at 2.75% in January as India shifts to new CPI base year 2024The data, released by the Ministry of Statistics and Programme Implementation, reflects a major statistical overhaul aimed at making India's inflation measure more representative of current consumption patterns.

A 90-year-old man was sold a 100-year policy. Why blaming the bank is not enoughHandcrafted ByOur Editors A 90-year-old man was sold an insurance policy maturing in 2124. The case sounds bizarre. But instances of mis-selling like this are painfully common across the country. The bank resolved the matter after a viral social media post. The harder question is why blaming the bank alone is not enough.

Sensex sinks over 500 points, Nifty tumbles as AI panic sinks IT stocksThe benchmark BSE Sensex fell 559 points to close at 85,674.92, while the Nifty 50 slipped below the psychologically important 25,900 mark.

Aviation body writes to government as it bids to tighten cabin crew fatigue ruleThe Federation of Indian Airlines (FIA) has asked the government to dilute parts of the draft rules. The industry body represents IndiGo and Air India, and has raised concerns that the changes may create operational and cost pressures.

IT stocks crack under global AI pressure. Is this a buying chance?The Nifty IT index fell 4.67% by 12 PM, hitting a four-month low. The selloff wiped out nearly Rs 1.3 lakh crore in combined market value in a single session. The IT pack on the Sensex was also down nearly 5%.

entertainment.headline: Anita Advani breaks silence on struggle after Rajesh Khanna's death Anita Advani has opened up about life after Rajesh Khanna's death, from legal battles to a will she claims she never saw.

After Laila Majnu, Ektaa Kapoor and Imtiaz Ali unveil new love saga Heer Ranjha The Laila Majnu universe is growing. Ektaa Kapoor and Imtiaz Ali announce Heer Ranjha on Valentine's Day, but how will this timeless romance be reimagined?

You're the best: Ananya Panday's birthday wish for Walker Blanco sparks buzz Actors Ananya Panday and Walker Blanco continue to fuel speculation about their relationship, sharing warm birthday wishes and public gestures on social media, while maintaining privacy regarding their status.

Arbaz Patel removed from The 50 for slapping Prince Narula: Report Arbaz Patel has reportedly been ousted from The 50 following a physical confrontation with Prince Narula. The incident, linked to remarks about Nikki Tamboli, underscores the show's zero-tolerance policy on violence.

Nayanthara calls Vignesh her 'home in human form' on Valentine's Day, he responds Actor Nayanthara and filmmaker Vignesh Shivan marked Valentine's Day with deeply personal notes, but it was one line about "home in human form" that truly stood out.

Ranbir Kapoor confirms Love & War postponed; to release after Ramayana Actor Ranbir Kapoor went live on Instagram to announce key updates about his upcoming films. He confirmed Ramayana for Diwali release and shared timelines for Love & War and Brahmastra 2, exciting fans with future projects.

Dalip Tahil posts Valentine's Day apology for being love's 'most reliable enemy' Bollywood actor Dalip Tahil marked Valentine's Day with a dramatic apology to "love" itself , but why did the veteran actor call himself its greatest enemy?

Himanshi Khurana gets Rs 10 crore extortion threat from Lawrence Bishnoi aide Lawrence Bishnoi gang operative Harry Boxer has allegedly threatened actor Himanshi Khurana with an extortion demand of Rs 10 crore, triggering a police alert.

Happy kathal day to all: Irrfan Khan's wife Sutapa has heartfelt Valentine's post On Valentine's Day, Sutapa Sikdar remembered Irrfan Khan in her own unfiltered way, with green vegetables, red memories and a quiet rebellion against cliches.

Malavika Mohanan clears air on stunt double row around Prabhas' The Raja Saab Malavika Mohanan has explained her use of a stunt double in The Raja Saab following online discussion sparked by behind-the-scenes images. She shared her perspective and experience with action scenes, providing insight into standard safety practices on film sets.

Hollywood hearts: Stars on their kind of Valentine's Day Hollywood stars are sharing their heartfelt and personal plans for Valentine's Day. These unique celebrations highlight love in simple and meaningful ways, inspiring fans across the world.

Ghayal hoon isliye Ghatak hoon: See Sunny Deol's reaction on viral Dhurandhar line Sunny Deol reacts to the use of his film titles in the hit movie Dhurandhar and shares insights into his upcoming projects.

Main Hoon: Salman-Chitrangda trace love beyond duty in new Battle of Galwan song The newly released song Main Hoon from Battle of Galwan, featuring Salman Khan and Chitrangda Singh, captures the complex emotions experienced by soldiers and their families, blending scenes of togetherness with the reality of separation and duty.

Wuthering Heights, O Romeo, Culpa trilogy: Is yearning Gen Z's new love language? In a fast-moving world, romance is slowing down. Stories across films, series and books now lean into yearning, a shift that's resonating strongly with Millennials and Gen Z in India.

Dhanush in legal row over shelved film, faces Rs 20 crore claim: Report Legal disputes involving Dhanush and Ranveer Singh have emerged over unfinished film projects, with production houses seeking compensation for alleged delays and financial losses.

Jason Momoa says gentleman Shah Rukh Khan is a better performer than him Jason Momoa shared high praise for Shah Rukh Khan during a recent interview, highlighting their mutual respect and friendship after meeting at events in Saudi Arabia.

O' Romeo box office Day 1: Shahid Kapoor's best opening in recent years Directed by Vishal Bhardwaj, O' Romeo opened to a promising start at the Indian box office, drawing audience interest despite mixed reviews over its lengthy runtime.

At a crossroads: Telugu cinema must balance old-school magic with new-age demands Telugu cinema stands at the crossroads of tradition and change. Even as it reaches for pan-India scale, its heartbeat lies in the rituals and emotional bonds that have always connected it to its audience.

Tu Yaa Main box office Day 1: Shanaya-Adarsh's thriller has a muted opening Tu Yaa Main, a survival thriller featuring Shanaya Kapoor and Adarsh Gourav, made a cautious start at the Indian box office with an estimated Rs 55 lakh on its opening day. Despite mixed reviews and modest occupancy, the film's unique premise and stronger opening compared to the leads' previous films offer hope for better performance ahead.

general news.headline: Missing Indian student Saketh Sreenivasaiah found dead in USSaketh Sreenivasaiah, the 22-year-old University of California student who had been missing since February 9, has been confirmed dead in the US.

PM Modi receives invite for Bangladesh PM-elect Tarique Rahman's oath ceremonyPM Modi has been invited by Bangladesh to attend the February 17 swearing-in of Tarique Rahman as Prime Minister following his BNP's sweeping election victory.

India wedded to strategic autonomy: S Jaishankar on US claim on Russian oil importsIndia asserts its energy purchases will be based on costs, risks and availability, not political pressure, amidst US sanctions on Russian oil. External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar emphasises India's commitment to strategic autonomy at the Munich Security Conference.

Trump open to meeting Ayatollah Khamenei, US says amid Iran tensionsRubio's comments came as the United States increases its military presence in the region, a move he said is intended to deter potential Iranian attacks on American forces and facilities.

IND vs PAK: Politics benched, it's time for cricket's 'El Cashico' in Colombo  Live updatesICC T20 World Cup: It is time for India vs Pakistan in Colombo. After days of boycott threats and frantic negotiations, the ICC's most valuable fixture has weathered the political storm and returned to the calendar. Once again, the T20 World Cup revolves around one night.

Bangladesh's new Cabinet led by Tarique Rahman to take oath on February 17Tarique Rahman will take oath as Bangladesh Prime Minister on February 17 along with a small cabinet after the BNP secured a two-thirds majority in the 13th parliamentary elections.

Time, Tide & Tamil Part 24 | Anna Arch: Arrival of The Alliterative ArchitectConjeevaram Natarajan Annadurai – Anna to the masses – was born into a modest weaver family from the Sengunthar Mudaliar community, an environment where the rhythmic, hypnotic clatter of the handloom provided the background score to a life of early intellectual curiosity. The loom itself was a profound metaphor for his later life: Perfecting the art of weaving disparate, often contradictory threads of thought into a singular, durable fabric of social justice.

In 1st remarks after election win, Tarique Rahman clears air on India tiesTarique Rahman, likely to be the next prime minister of Bangladesh, spoke on the future of India ties in his first address after steering the BNP to a landslide election win.

Video: Man steals bride's bag containing valuables worth Rs 4 lakh during weddingThe incident took place on February 7 at Chandan One Marriage Garden in the Jagatpura area, where the wedding celebrations of Naveen Karol were underway.

The Biography of a Toilet Paper: How Pakistan became America's Disposable AllyFor seven decades, Pakistan has repeatedly offered itself as America's strategic pawn, only to be discarded when no longer useful. It is a pattern of servitude enabled through its own desperation and greed.

Got assurance from India to stop buying Russian oil: Marco Rubio after trade dealEarlier, Russian Foreign Minister Sergey Lavrov dismissed reports of any such assurance, saying that no one besides US officials had spoken about India possibly halting Russian oil imports.

Clear, dry conditions to prevail on Sunday, shift expected from MondayClear, dry conditions are set to prevail across India this Sunday. A significant weather shift is expected from Monday as a Western Disturbance nears, bringing rain and snow to the Himalayas.

Watch: Surya mimics Usman Tariq's action, preps India for out-of-syllabus questionT20 World Cup, IND vs PAK: Indian captain Suryakumar Yadav mimicked Usman Tariq's stop-start bowling action in the nets to help teammates prepare for Pakistan's mystery spinner ahead of their T20 World Cup clash in Colombo on Sunday.

Love, bullets on Valentine's Day: Couple found dead in car in NoidaThe bodies of Sumit and Rekha were found with gunshot wounds in a Tata Altroz near Noida Sector 39. Initial probe has suggested that Sumit first shot Rekha before turning the pistol on himself.

1 killed in Mumbai Metro pillar collapse; firm fined Rs 5 crore, engineer suspendedPart of an under-construction metro pillar collapsed in Mumbai's Mulund, crushing an autorickshaw and part of a car, killing one and injuring three people.
Ajit Pawar's nephew writes to Amit Shah, seeks probe into uncle's plane crashFormer Maharashtra Deputy Chief Minister Ajit Pawar died after his private jet crashed in Baramati on January 28.

RIP European Super League: The end of football's most hated modern experimentReal Madrid's peace deal with UEFA has finally closed the book on the European Super League. What began as a breakaway power grab ends as a reminder that football's soul still belongs to its fans.

Will Abhishek Sharma return? Can India's spinners dominate? Will Pakistan stick to their guns? All eyes on Sunday.

This 300-year-old institution was the world's first engineering collegeThe world's first engineering college in Europe is considered the backbone of modern engineering achievements. It laid the foundation for many scientific and technological advancements that followed.

PM Modi makes historic touchdown on Assam's first emergency landing highwayPrime Minister Narendra Modi landed at the Northeast's first Emergency Landing Facility in Assam's Moran to inaugurate the strip and launch projects worth over Rs 5,500 crore.

Passenger claims he was told to cooperate, adjust despite confirmed AC seats in trainAn Indian Railways passenger ranted about how he paid for confirmed 3rd AC seats but was asked to adjust by sharing seats during a train five-hour journey.

Hopeful India will extradite Hasina, says BNP leader; sees no hurdle in tiesSenior BNP leader Mirza Fakhrul Islam Alamgir said the party is hopeful India will extradite former PM Sheikh Hasina if due legal process is followed.

sports.headline: Abhishek will haunt Pakistan again: Harbhajan slams Amir for slogger remark Harbhajan Singh fired back at Mohammad Amir for his slogger remark on Abhishek Sharma before warning the former pacer that the Indian opener can haunt Pakistan once again. Abhishek is expected to be back in the starting lineup for the India vs Pakistan clash.

IND vs PAK: Pakistan's dugout gets an uninvited guest as snake pops up in Colombo T20 World Cup: A bizarre twist hit Colombo when a snake was spotted inside Pakistan's dugout ahead of the India clash. With both teams unbeaten, Sunday's IND vs PAK blockbuster promises drama on and off the field.

Premadasa Stadium in Colombo. Meanwhile, India have recieved a huge boost with Abhishek Sharma looking match-ready in the nets session on the eve of the marquee clash.

2023 Hero, 2026 X-Factor: Will Kishan be Pakistan's nightmare again in Colombo? After once haunting Pakistan in Pallekele in 2023, Ishan Kishan comes back to the island nation with a new mindset and role as a destroyer right at the top. With his ability to play spin improved, will the wicketkeeper-batter become a nightmare for the Pakistan side?

Yes, Usman Tariq is dangerous, but Pakistan shouldn't forget Varun Chakravarthy  India vs Pakistan, T20 World Cup: The focus will be on Usman Tariq when India and Pakistan face off in Colombo on Sunday, but Varun Chakravarthy could steal the limelight as India look to make it three wins in three matches in the ongoing tournament.

Matchday Preview: Dominant India, West Indies look to seal Super 8 spots T20 World Cup: Day 9 of the tournament starts with West Indies facing Nepal at the Wankhede Stadium. Thereafter, Namibia and USA will face off in a Group A clash before India and Pakistan lock horns in Colombo.

Harmanpreet Kaur wins hearts with adorable gesture for distressed kid: Watch INDW vs AUSW: Harmanpreet Kaur won hearts with her heartfelt gesture toward a distressed child as India gear up to take on Australia in a three-match T20I series.

India's poor run in FIH Pro League continues, lose 2-4 against Belgium in return leg India slumped to their third straight defeat in the FIH Pro League, going down 2-4 to Belgium in Rourkela despite a spirited second-half fightback. Belgium's sharp finishing and structured build-up play ensured they raced to a commanding lead before India could settle into rhythm.

Bangladesh cricket chief opts out of attending India-Pakistan T20 World Cup clashT20 World Cup: Bangladesh Cricket Board president Aminul Islam Bulbul declined to attend the India-Pakistan match due to Bangladesh's absence from the tournament. His decision follows Bangladesh's withdrawal from the tournament over security concerns.

South Africa hand New Zealand a reality check, extend unbeaten streakICC Men's T20 World Cup: Marco Jansen's sensational four-wicket haul, coupled with captain Aiden Markram's magnificent unbeaten 86-run knock, helped South Africa gun down the 176-run target in 17.1 overs, handing a hapless New Zealand side a comprehensive defeat and extending their unbeaten run in Ahmedabad.

India being favourites, puts them under more pressure than Pakistan: Sunil GavaskarT20 World Cup, IND vs PAK: Sunil Gavaskar believes India will experience heightened pressure heading into their Pakistan clash, primarily due to sky-high expectations from supporters.

"India at the start is the favourite. The way India have been playing, everybody expects them to win," Gavaskar observed, noting that the opposition will naturally try to upset those predictions.

The former captain suggested a familiar remedy for handling such pressure: "Shut the noise off. Don't read anything about cricket, just talk amongst yourself, keep each other company, have that little banter and keep your spirits up."

Gavaskar emphasised the importance of staying present rather than overthinking the high-stakes encounter against their arch-rivals.

Fearless not reckless: Gavaskar's advice to India's batters ahead of Pakistan clashT20 World Cup 2026: Sunil Gavaskar warns India against reckless batting ahead of Pakistan clash, advocates for Washington Sundar's inclusion at spin-friendly Premadasa as calculated aggression becomes key focus.

Don't want to peak too early, says Brook as England build towards business endEngland may not yet have found their fluency, but captain Harry Brook believes that could prove a blessing in disguise as the two-time champions aim to build momentum steadily and peak at the business end of the T20 World Cup.

The Three Lions moved up to second place in the Group C table after chasing 153 in 18.2 overs.

NZ vs SA Highlights: Captain Markram stars in South Africa's 7-wicket winNew Zealand (NZ) vs South Africa (SA) Highlights, T20 World Cup: It was a captain's knock from Aiden Markram as his unbeaten 86 led to South Africa's win over New Zealand in Ahmedabad.

If Pakistan want Abhishek Sharma to play, he will play: Suryakumar YadavIND vs PAK, T20 World Cup: Suryakumar Yadav has hinted at young Abhishek Sharma's return to India's playing XI. Abhishek did not feature in India's last game, against Namibia, due to illness.

T20 World Cup, IND vs PAK: PCB chief Mohsin Naqvi to attend India clashT20 World Cup: Pakistan Cricket Board (PCB) Chairman Mohsin Naqvi will attend Sunday's India vs Pakistan clash in Colombo. His visit is also expected to include talks with ICC officials following a brief boycott episode that had threatened the marquee fixture.

Afghanistan's Gurbaz earns Virat Kohli's respect, gifted bats after Ahmedabad showT20 World Cup: Virat Kohli gifted Rahmanullah Gurbaz two bats after his stunning T20 World Cup knock. The Afghan star called Kohli "not just a legend, but the inspiration for all generations" on Instagram.

T20 World Cup: Pakistan's Salman Agha wants Abhishek Sharma challenge in IND vs PAKPakistan skipper Salman Ali Agha hopes the world No. 1 T20I batter, Abhishek Sharma, will play the high-voltage Group A clash of the ICC Men's T20 World Cup 2026 between India and Pakistan. The arch-rivals will meet in match No. 27 on Sunday (February 15) at R. Premadasa Stadium in Colombo.

Australia vs India, Women's T20I series: Squads, all you need to knowAUSW vs INDW: Harmanpreet Kaur's India and Sophie Molineux's Australia are all set to face off in a three-match T20I series, starting February 15 at the Sydney Cricket Ground. India started the tour with a five-wicket win over Governor General XI Women.

Pramod Bhagat bags record sixth BWF Para World Championships titleIndia's Pramod Bhagat captured the men's SL3 gold medal with a commanding straight-game win over Indonesia's Muhammad Al Imran at the BWF Para World Championships on Saturday.

Harmanpreet Kaur calls for more Tests as India brace for tough Australia tourAUSW vs INDW: Harmanpreet Kaur said that India have enjoyed playing Test cricket and would want to play more in the future. Harmanpreet is set to lead India in the Australia tour, starting with the three-match T20I series.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
